snippet.title: Pong / Asteroids / Yars' Revenge - Game Boy Advance Gameplay
snippet.description:
Released in 2005, this GBA compilation was published by Destination Software (along with ZOO Digital Publishing for the European release) and developed by EC-Interactive. It was one of the three budget compilations as part of their collaboration with Atari SA.

While Pong and Asteroids were fine conversions, since the two are generally hard to screw up, Yars' Revenge seems to be off. Although the sound is actually fine, the GBA conversion is actually slower than the original on the Atari 2600.

Being a budget game for the GBA, there's almost no documentation regarding critic reviews. The only critic review that does exist online is from GameSpot, who gave it a 5/10, stating that "while this compilation offers a marginally enjoyable trip down memory lane with three Atari classics, it's tough to recommend because the games are so ancient--not to mention that there's a total lack of any ancillary features. The inability to save high scores is particularly tragic."

Granted, they aren't exact ports, but credit where it's due, EC-Interactive did a fine job, even if Yars' Revenge isn't exactly as fast as on the 2600.

Yars' Revenge, PONG, Asteroids (C) Atari SA

#retrogames #retrogaming #atari #atari2600 #arcade #atariarcade #pong #yarsrevenge #asteroids #gba #gameboyadvance 

FUN FACT: I actually owned a boxed copy of this game during my vacation in Tenerife a long time ago when I was a kid, probably sometime around 2009 (or was it 2010? 2011?). I had a Nintendo DS Lite with me and since it was able to run GBA games, I had to get that one along with Shrek SuperSlam. When I returned to Tenerife last year, the store that sold this and other retro games sadly closed down. It was deeply sad and depressing for me to find out, since there was barely anything for me to find, but times have changed, for better or worse. The theme and menu music are still stuck to my mind to this day, as a reminder of my innocence. And this compilation was my first time I ever played Yars' Revenge. I have grown to love that 2600 classic since then.
